fceef955-e474-41d3-b49a-1c205bdba302.description: Earners of the Credentialing Specialist Certificate badge have demonstrated their knowledge into the eco-system of certification from a program's conception, through its development and delivery, to maintenance and renewal.

886bbea0-1096-47bd-a885-3694a4773999.description: Earners of the I.C.E. Organizational Member badge have demonstrated their understanding of best practices in credentialing, and how to incorporate them into their daily activities and specific role. b76b4e6d-e168-4c0c-a4be-f0959ae2f5de.description: Earners of the NCCA Accredited Certification Program badge have demonstrated their understanding of, and compliance with, the NCCA Standards for Accreditation of Certification Programs. Programs earning this badge have been evaluated in each of the following areas: (1) Purpose, Governance, and Resources, (2) Responsibilities to Stakeholders, (3) Assessment Instruments, (4) Recertification, (5) Quality Assurance, and (6) Maintaining Accreditation.
b76b4e6d-e168-4c0c-a4be-f0959ae2f5de.name: NCCA Accredited Program

issuer.summary: issued by Institute for Credentialing Excellence

alignments.name: NCCA Standards for Certification Programs
alignments.description: The NCCA's Standards for Accreditation for Certification Programs, which were created in the mid-1970s, were the first standards developed by the credentialing industry for professional certification programs.

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits rigorous application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed a certification program which includes an assessment instrument that meets the NCCA Standards for Accreditation of Certification Programs.
Organization has developed a credentialing program. The program awards a credential in compliance with the NCCA Standards for Accreditation of Certification Programs.
